_description: PDET context enrichment for DIM05 focusing on long-term impact definition, structural transformations, and sustainability in PDET municipalities

gate_1_scope.justification: DIM05 requires access to PDET long-term transformation goals, structural change indicators, and sustainability frameworks

gate_2_value_add.justification: Provides frameworks for assessing long-term structural transformations aligned with PDET 15-year vision

gate_3_capability.justification: Methods must identify impact statements, assess structural change logic, and evaluate long-term sustainability

primary_pillars.pillar_name: Reconciliaci贸n, convivencia y construcci贸n de paz
impact_requirements: Cultural change toward non-violent conflict resolution
typical_impacts: Homicide rate reduced by >50% sustained over 10 years
Land conflicts resolved through legal mechanisms (not violence)
Trust in institutions index increased >20 points

primary_pillars.pillar_name: Ordenamiento social de la propiedad rural
impact_requirements: Elimination of forced displacement due to land disputes
typical_impacts: Gini coefficient for land reduced from 0.85 to <0.70
Zero forced displacements due to land conflicts

impact_requirements: Structural economic transformation from illicit to licit

structural_transformation_focus.definition: Changes in fundamental structures, systems, power relations, or cultural patterns that are self-sustaining
examples_valid: Transformation from violence-based to law-based land conflict resolution
Shift from subsistence to market-integrated rural economy
Change from authoritarian to participatory governance culture
examples_invalid: Outcomes dependent on external funding (not self-sustaining)
structural_transformation_focus.justification: PDET aims for structural peace and development; impacts must reflect fundamental rather than incremental change

fifteen_year_horizon.justification: PDET decree establishes 15-year implementation period; impacts must be achievable and measurable within this timeframe

sustainability_specification.justification: Impacts must be self-sustaining beyond PDET period; many past interventions collapsed after external support ended

attribution_complexity.justification: Long-term impacts have multiple causes; PDT cannot claim sole attribution but can show contribution

territorial_equity.justification: PDET aims to close territorial gaps; impacts must show reduction in rural-urban and inter-vereda inequities

conflict_transformation.justification: PDET's core purpose is structural peacebuilding; impacts must demonstrate conflict transformation not just violence reduction

gap_1_outcome_mislabeled_as_impact.description: Medium-term outcomes (e.g., 'increased school enrollment') presented as long-term impacts
gap_1_outcome_mislabeled_as_impact.impact: Confuses planning logic; no vision for structural transformation
gap_1_outcome_mislabeled_as_impact.remediation: Apply 'sustainability test': if external funding stops, does change persist? If no, it's not an impact

gap_2_no_sustainability_mechanism.description: Impacts stated without explaining how they will be maintained after PDT period
gap_2_no_sustainability_mechanism.impact: Gains likely to reverse; no institutional ownership
gap_2_no_sustainability_mechanism.remediation: Mandate explicit sustainability strategies for each claimed impact

gap_3_unrealistic_timelines.description: Impacts requiring generational change claimed within 4-year PDT period
gap_3_unrealistic_timelines.remediation: Cross-check claimed impacts against realistic transformation timelines

gap_4_generic_impacts.description: Impacts like 'improved quality of life' that could apply anywhere
gap_4_generic_impacts.impact: Fails to address PDET-specific structural challenges
gap_4_generic_impacts.remediation: Require impacts explicitly addressing conflict, land, illicit economies, or territorial exclusion
